intro: Comesperma drummondii, commonly known as the Drummond's comesperma, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open woodlands or heathlands. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces woody fruits that contain several seeds. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and ecological adaptations.
